hypothesis_content.title: Post-QT Liquidity Pump to BTC/ETH Ratio Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: Following the announced end of Quantitative Tightening (QT) and $13.5B liquidity injection, capital will rotate from BTC (perceived as digital gold/store of value) into ETH (perceived as tech/growth proxy) within 5 trading days, causing the BTC/ETH ratio to decline by at least 3% from its pre-announcement level.
hypothesis_content.rationale: The end of QT represents a structural shift from liquidity withdrawal to injection. Historically, new liquidity favors higher-beta, 'growth' narratives (ETH) over 'store of value' (BTC) in early stages. The October liquidity crash created oversold conditions in ETH relative to BTC, setting up a mean reversion trade.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH 30-day rolling ratio > 1.5 standard deviations above its 90-day mean
Daily net liquidity flow (Fed balance sheet change + reverse repo drain) turns positive for 2 consecutive days
BTC dominance (total crypto market cap) shows 3-day stagnation or decline while total market cap increases

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC/ETH ratio declines by 4% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC/ETH ratio increases by 2% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: BTC/ETH ratio continues to rise or remains flat despite positive liquidity flows for 5+ days, indicating either 1) liquidity is not reaching crypto markets, or 2) BTC's store-of-value narrative is overpowering growth rotation.
